intro: Solanum sanmartiniense, commonly known as the San Martín nightshade, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters in height, characterized by its thick, woody stems and dark green, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale green flowers that bloom in the evening, followed by edible berries that turn red when mature. It is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in cloud forests, where it thrives in moist, shaded conditions.
